bug.short_desc: Fedora Media Writer corrupts downloaded 25 image
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): The Fedora Media Writer does not have a visible release number
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Open Fedora Media Writer 2.Select Fedora Workstation and Naak Live USB, Download starts 3.
Actual results: After Downloading is finished an message is displayed that the image is corrupted
Expected results: Writing to USB
Additional info:

Hello, Fedora Media Writer has a visible release number if you scroll to the bottom of the list of available Fedora spins. Are you sure the image is actually corrupted when you try to download again, please? The only reason for this happening I can think of is the image actually being corrupt.

Version 4.0.7-0.fc25
I now see what probably the problem is.
The temp folder in my Windows 10 test system is in ram with limited storage. Fedora Media Writer seems to miss the fact that the image was not downloaded completely and therefor corrupt and reported as such.
Suggested feature: Let media writer check how much space is available and if not enough give the option to select another download storage device.
Oh, yes, I think I already fixed that but I'll check again to be sure the warning is actually there. Thanks for the report!
